text.ori_cn: §大学之道，在明明德，在亲民，在止于至善。
text.man_en: The way of the great learning is to rid oneself of selfish desires and develop further one's inherent virtues. One should not only develop his own inherent virtues further, but should encourage all persons to do so also.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The way of the university is to be clear and virtuous, to be kind to the people, and to stop at the highest good.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The way of a university lies in being virtuous, being close to the people, and striving for perfection.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The way of the university lies in manifesting bright virtue, in loving the people, and in reaching the ultimate good.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 绝学之道在于摒弃私欲，进一步发展自己的内在美德。一个人不仅要进一步发展自己的内在美德，还要鼓励所有人都这样做。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 大学之道，在于去除私欲，进一步发展自己的美德。一个人不仅应该进一步发展自己固有的美德，而且应该鼓励所有人都这样做。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 大学之道，在明明德，在亲民，在止于至善。不仅要自身修养明德，还要鼓励他人一起修养明德。

text.ori_cn: 知止而后有定，定而后能静，静而后能安，安而后能虑，虑而后能得。
text.man_en: Only then is it possible to reach the acme of perfection. Once the acme of perfection is attained, is a man able to set the orientation of his ambitions. After setting his orientation, he will not waiver in his ambition and will be satisfied with his position. Satisfied with his position, he can ponder well. Being able to ponder well, he will be able to achieve all he wants.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Knowing the stop is followed by determination, determination is followed by tranquillity, tranquillity is followed by peace, peace is followed by consideration, and consideration is followed by attainment.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Knowing that there is stillness can lead to concentration, concentration can lead to tranquility, tranquility can lead to tranquility, tranquility can lead to worry, and worry can lead to gain.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when one knows to stop can he find stability; with stability, calmness follows; with calmness, he can achieve peace; with peace, he becomes capable of thought; with contemplation, he attains.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有这样，才有可能达到完美的顶峰。一旦达到完美的顶点，一个人就能够确定自己的志向。确定了方向，他就不会动摇自己的志向，就会满足于自己的位置。安于其位，方能善思。善于思考，就能实现自己的一切愿望。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有这样，才可能达到炉火纯青的境界。一旦达到了极致，一个人就能确定自己的野心方向。确定了方向之后，他就不会放弃自己的野心，也会对自己的地位感到满意。他对自己的处境很满意，能够好好思考。能够好好思考，他想要的一切就能够实现。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只有这样才能达到完美的顶峰。一旦达到完美的顶峰，一个人就能确定他志向的方向。确定方向后，他的志向就不会动摇，并且会满足于自己的位置。满足于自己的位置，他就能很好地思考。能够很好地思考，他就能实现他所有的愿望。

text.ori_cn: 物有本末，事有终始，知所先后，则近道矣。
text.man_en: All things have their important and unimportant aspects; all events have their start and finish. If one knows the order of priority, he is not far from the way of the great learning.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Things have their origin and end, things have their beginning and end; if you know the sequence, you are close to the way.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Things have a beginning and an end, and things have an end and a beginning. If you know the sequence, you will get the shortcut.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Things have their root and branches, affairs have their beginning and end. If one knows the order of precedence, one is near to the Way.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 凡事皆有轻重缓急，凡事皆有始有终。知其轻重缓急，则离大道不远矣。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 任何事物都有其重要和不重要的方面；所有事件都有其开始和结束。如果知道先后顺序，那么离大学之道就不远了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 凡事都有其重要和不重要的方面；所有事件都有其开始与结束。如果一个人知道轻重缓急的顺序，他便已接近大学之道。

text.ori_cn: §古之欲明明德于天下者，先治其国；欲治其国者，先齐其家；欲齐其家者，先修其身；欲修其身者，先正其心；欲正其心者，先诚其意；欲诚其意者，先致其知；致知在格物。
text.man_en: In ancient times, one who intended to carry forward all the inherent virtues in the world and to rid people of material desires had to first rule his state well. To rule his state well, he had to first educate his family. To educate his family, he had first to cultivate himself. To cultivate himself, he had first to set his heart right. To set his heart right, he had first to be sincere and honest. 6 To be sincere and honest, he had first to perfect his knowledge and the perfection of his knowledge depended on his investigation of things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: In ancient times, those who wished to make the world clear and virtuous first ruled their country; those who wished to rule their country first united their families; those who wished to unite their families first cultivated their bodies; those who wished to cultivate their bodies first corrected their minds; those who wished to correct their minds first honoured their will; those who wished to honour their wills first attained knowledge; and the attainment of knowledge was based on the conception of the material things.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: In ancient times, if you want to bring enlightenment and virtue to the world, you must first govern your country; if you want to govern your country, you must first regulate your family; if you want to regulate your family, you must first cultivate your body; if you want to cultivate your body, you must first rectify your mind; if you want to rectify your family, you must first rectify your mind. To be sincere in your heart, you must first be sincere in your intentions; if you want to be sincere in your intentions, you must first gain knowledge; to gain knowledge is to investigate things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those in ancient times who wished to illuminate their virtuous qualities to the world would first govern their own states; those wishing to govern their states would first regulate their own families; those wishing to regulate their families would first cultivate their own selves; those wishing to cultivate their selves would first rectify their own hearts; those wishing to rectify their hearts would first ensure their own sincere intentions; those wishing to ensure their own sincere intentions would first attain knowledge; attaining knowledge lies in the investigation of things.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在古代，一个人要想发扬光大世间固有的美德，使人们摆脱物质欲望，就必须先治理好自己的国家。欲治其国者，先齐其家。欲教其家，先修其身。要修身，首先要正心。欲正其心，先诚其意。6 要做到真诚和诚实，首先要完善自己的知识，而知识的完善取决于对事物的探究。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 古之欲弘扬天下之德，除人之物欲，必先治好国家。要想治好国家，首先要教育好自己的家庭。要教育家人，首先要修身。修身，首先要摆正自己的心。要想摆正自己的心，首先要真诚、诚实。 6 要想真诚诚实，首先要完善自己的知识，而知识的完善则取决于他对事物的考察。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在古代，一个人若想发扬世间一切固有的美德，消除人们的物质欲望，必须先治理好他的国家。要治理好他的国家，他必须先教育好他的家庭。要教育好他的家庭，他必须先修养自己。要修养自己，他必须先端正自己的心态。要端正自己的心态，他必须先做到真诚和诚实。要做到真诚和诚实，他必须先完善自己的知识，而知识的完善取决于他对事物的探究。

text.ori_cn: 物格而后知至，知至而后意诚，意诚而后心正，心正而后身修，身修而后家齐，家齐而后国治，国治而后天下平。
text.man_en: After observing things, one will know, and after knowing one's thoughts, one will be sincere, one's mind will be sincere, then one's heart will be upright, one's heart will be right, then one will cultivate the body, if one cultivates one's body, then the family will be in order, if the family is in order, the country will be governed, and if the country is governed, then the world will be peaceful.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: After the object is grasped, then the knowledge comes; after the knowledge comes, the intention is sincere; after the intention is sincere, the heart is correct; after the heart is correct, the body is repaired; after the body is repaired, the family is aligned; after the family is aligned, the country is ruled; after the country is ruled, the world is at peace.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: After observing things, one will know, and after knowing one's thoughts, one will be sincere, one's mind will be sincere, then one's heart will be upright, one's heart will be right, then one will cultivate the body, if one cultivates one's body, then the family will be in order, if the family is in order, the country will be governed, and if the country is governed, then the world will be peaceful.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only after investigating things can knowledge be extended; only after knowledge is extended can thoughts be sincere; only after thoughts are sincere can the heart be rectified; only after the heart is rectified can the person be cultivated; only after the person is cultivated can the family be regulated; only after the family is regulated can the state be well-governed; only after the state is well-governed can there be peace under heaven.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 观物而后知人，知人而后心诚，心诚则心正，心正则身修，身修则家齐，家齐则国治，国治则天下平。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 观物而知，知其意，则诚，心诚，则心正，心正，则修身，修身。则家治，家治则国治，国治则天下太平。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 物有本末，事有终始，知所先后，则近道矣。致知在格物，物格而后知至，知至而后意诚，意诚而后心正，心正而后身修，身修而后家齐，家齐而后国治，国治而后天下平。

text.ori_cn: 自天子以至于庶人，壹是皆以修身为本。
text.man_en: From emperor to the common people, selfcultivation is the base.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Since the son of heaven to the common people, one is all to cultivate the body as the basis.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: From the emperor to the common people, everything is based on self-cultivation.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: From the Son of Heaven down to the common people, all must consider self-cultivation as the foundation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上至帝王将相，下至黎民百姓，修身为本。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 上至帝王，下至百姓，修身是根本。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 从天子到庶民，修身是根本。

text.ori_cn: 其本乱而末治者，否矣。
text.man_en: If the base is in disorder, is it possible to rule well the state which is at the end of the order of priority? No, it is impossible!
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is not true that it is chaotic at first but not at last.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is wrong if it is originally chaotic but ends up being governed.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It is impossible to achieve stability at the end when chaos reigns at the start.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果基础混乱不堪，有可能治理好处于优先顺序末尾的国家吗？不可能！
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果基础乱了，排在最后的国家能治好吗？不，这是不可能的！
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 本根已乱，能治其末乎？不可也！

text.ori_cn: 其所厚者薄，而其所薄者厚，未之有也。
text.man_en: It is not right to take what is unimportant as important and vice versa.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: What it is thick is thin, and what it is thin is thick, not yet.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What is thick is thin, and what is thin is thick, which is not what it is.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There has never been a case where those who are favored are treated lightly, and those who are not favored are treated generously.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 把不重要的当成重要的，反之亦然，这是不对的。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 把不重要的事情当成重要的事情是不对的，反之亦然。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 把不重要的当作重要的，把重要的当作不重要的是不对的。

text.ori_cn: 此谓知本，此谓知之至也。
text.man_en: This is called “know the limit”. This is the acme of knowledge.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is called the knowledge of the origin, and this is called the knowledge of the most.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is called knowing the basics, and this is called knowing the ultimate.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called knowing the root; this is called the ultimate knowledge.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是所谓的 "知道极限"。这是知识的最高境界。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是所谓的“知道极限”。这就是知识的极致。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这叫做“知其限度”。这是知识的极致。

text.ori_cn: §所谓诚其意者，毋自欺也。
text.man_en: “Be sincere and honest” in “Jing” means a man must not deceive himself.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The so-called sincerity of one's intention is not to deceive oneself.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The so-called person who means what he means sincerely should not deceive himself.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To be sincere in one's intentions means not to deceive oneself.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "精 "中的 "精诚 "是指人不可自欺。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《经》中的“诚”，就是说做人不能自欺欺人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “诚实和真诚”在“敬”中意味着一个人不可自欺。

text.ori_cn: 如恶恶臭，如好好色，此之谓自谦。
text.man_en: He can only be happy and satisfied if he detests evil as he loves beautiful things.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As bad as a bad smell, as good as a good colour, this is called self-effacement.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Like hating bad odors, like loving lust, this is called self-effacement.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Dislike evil as detesting an unpleasant odor, appreciate good as admiring a beautiful color - this is called self-modesty.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 他只有像热爱美好事物一样憎恶邪恶，才能获得幸福和满足。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有厌恶邪恶、热爱美好事物，他才能感到快乐和满足。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 他只有像热爱美丽事物一样憎恶邪恶，才能感到幸福和满足。

text.ori_cn: 故君子必慎其独也。
text.man_en: So a gentleman is cautious when he is alone.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, a gentleman must be careful with his solitude.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a gentleman must be careful about his independence.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a gentleman must exercise caution when he is alone.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以，君子独处时要谨慎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以君子独处时要谨慎。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以君子在独处时要谨慎。

text.ori_cn: 小人闲居为不善，无所不至；见君子而后厌然,掩其不善,而著其善。
text.man_en: A petty person may do all kinds of evils, but when he is faced with a gentleman, he is evasive, trying to cover up his bad deeds and pretend that he has done good.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The little man lives in idleness for the ungodly, and does everything; but when he sees a gentleman, he is disgusted with him, and covers up his ungodliness, and makes his goodness known to him.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is not good for a villain to live idle, and he will do anything. When he sees a gentleman, he will be disgusted with it, cover up his bad deeds, and focus on his good deeds.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a petty person is idle, they engage in all sorts of misconduct without restraint; but upon meeting a gentleman, they become abashed, hide their misdeeds, and display their virtues.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 小人可以无恶不作，但面对君子，他就会躲躲闪闪，试图掩盖自己的恶行，假装自己做了好事。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 小人可能无恶不作，但面对君子却避而不谈，极力掩盖自己的坏事，假装自己做了好事。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 小人可能做各种恶事，但当他面对君子时，他会逃避，试图掩盖自己的坏事，假装自己做了好事。

text.ori_cn: 人之视已，如见其肺肝然，则可益矣。
text.man_en: But others know what he has done as if his body was transparent. What good are all these pretenses to him?
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a person sees his lungs and liver as if they were already there, then he can be benefited.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person looks at it and sees that his lungs and liver are weak, it will be beneficial.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: If a person were to see their own heart and liver as clearly as they see others, they would benefit greatly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但别人知道他做了什么，就好像他的身体是透明的一样。这些伪装对他有什么好处？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但其他人却知道他做了什么，就好像他的身体是透明的一样。这些借口对他来说有什么好处呢？
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但其他人似乎能看穿他所做的一切。他伪装得再好，又有什么用呢？

text.ori_cn: 此谓诚于中，形于外。
text.man_en: Sincerity and honesty will show themselves outwardly.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is called sincerity in the middle and form in the outside.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is called sincerity in the inside and form in the outside.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This is called being genuine within and manifesting it outwardly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 真诚和诚实会表现在外表上。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 真诚和诚实会表现在外在。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 真诚和诚实会表现在外在行为上。

text.ori_cn: 故君子必慎其独也。
text.man_en: This is why a gentleman will be cautious when he is alone.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, a gentleman must be careful with his solitude.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a gentleman must be careful about his independence.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a gentleman must exercise caution when he is alone.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是为什么绅士在独处时会小心翼翼。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是为什么君子独处时会谨慎。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是为什么君子独处时会谨慎的原因。

text.ori_cn: 富润屋，德润身，心广体胖，故君子必诚其意。
text.man_en: A rich man's house may be decorated luxuriously, but his selfcultivation is enhanced only when he is virtuous. A man's posture is composed if he is broadminded. So a gentleman should always be sincere and honest.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Rich Run House, Virtue Run Body, heart wide body fat, so the gentleman must be sincere in his intentions.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A prosperous house, a prosperous body with virtue, a broad mind and a fat body, therefore a gentleman must be sincere in his intentions.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Wealth enriches a house; virtue enriches the body. With a calm mind and a healthy body, thus a gentleman must make his thoughts sincere.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 富人的房子可以装修得很豪华，但只有当他有德行时，他的自我修养才会得到提升。一个人心胸宽广，姿态才会端庄。因此，君子应始终保持真诚和正直。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有钱人的房子可以装修得很豪华，但只有有道德，他的修养才能提高。一个人心胸宽广，姿态就沉稳。所以君子应该始终保持真诚和诚实。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个富人的房子可能装饰得很豪华，但只有当他有美德时，他的修养才会得到提升。一个人如果心胸开阔，他的姿态就会镇定自若。所以，君子应该始终真诚和诚实。

text.ori_cn: §《诗》云：“瞻彼淇澳，菉竹猗猗。
text.man_en: The Book of Songs said, “Green bamboo prospers on the banks of Qi River.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The poem reads: "Looking at Qi'ao, green bamboo.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Poetry" says: "Looking at Qi'ao, there are bamboos and Yiyi.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Book of Poetry says: 'Gaze upon the banks of the Qi River, where the green bamboo sways gracefully.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诗经》说："淇水之滨，青竹之茂。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《诗经》云：“岐江畔翠竹茂。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《诗经》说：“青青子衿，悠悠我心，纵我不往，子宁不嗣音？”

text.ori_cn: 有斐君子，如切如磋，如琢如磨。
text.man_en: A gentleman who studies diligently seems to be cutting bone objects incessantly,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are feijuns, like cutting and polishing.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a noble gentleman who is like discussing with each other, like polishing.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A cultured gentleman is refined through self-discipline, like jade cut and polished, like stone chiseled and ground.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 君子学而时习之，不亦说乎？
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 勤奋读书的君子，仿佛不断地削骨器，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个勤奋学习的君子似乎在不断地切割骨头物品，

text.ori_cn: 瑟兮僴兮，赫兮喧兮。
text.man_en: working at the tusk of an elephant with care and precision, grinding the stone in a rigorous and scientific way,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Sakura is a very loud and noisy one.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is seductive and noisy.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Majestic and solemn, bright and resounding.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 在大象的象牙上小心翼翼地工作，以严谨和科学的方式打磨石头、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 仔细而精确地加工大象的象牙，以严谨而科学的方式研磨石头，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 小心翼翼地在大象的象牙上工作，以严谨和科学的方式打磨石头，

text.ori_cn: 有斐君子，终不可諠兮。”
text.man_en: looking strong and resolute. People would never forget such a gentleman. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There are fei gentlemen, and ultimately there can be no rumpus."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you have a noble gentleman, you should never make noise. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A noble gentleman should never be forgotten.

text.ori_cn: 如切如磋者，道学也；如琢如磨者，自修也；瑟兮僴兮者，恂傈也；赫兮喧兮者，威仪也；有斐君子，终不可諠兮者，道盛德至善，民之不能忘也。
text.man_en: In the song, cutting object implies studying diligently, working at the tusk of an elephant means cultivating oneself, grinding the stone indicates working with care and trepidation, and strong and resolute are the descriptions of his appearance. People never forget such a gentleman of his noble virtues, honorable ambitions and decent behavior.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If it is cut like a dagger, it is Taoism; if it is cut like a grind, it is self-cultivation; if it is thrown, it is lisping; if it is heated, it is mighty; if it is a Fijian gentleman, it cannot be bawled out; if it is a man who is so good that the people can't forget him, he can't forget him.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who are as thorough as studying are Taoists; those who are as polished as polishers are self-study; those who are arrogant and arrogant are those who are coquettish; those who are arrogant and noisy are dignitaries; those who are good gentlemen and cannot be noisy at all are the virtues of Taoism. The people cannot forget the supreme kindness.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Like cutting and polishing, so is the study of the way; like chiseling and grinding, so is self-cultivation. Glorious and majestic, so is cautious propriety; shining and resplendent, so is awe-inspiring demeanor. An illustrious gentleman, who cannot be forgotten, embodies the way of supreme virtue and goodness, which the people cannot forget.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 歌中 "切物 "寓意勤奋学习，"象牙 "寓意修身养性，"磨石 "寓意小心谨慎，"刚毅 "则是对其外貌的描写。人们永远不会忘记这样一位品德高尚、志向远大、行为端庄的君子。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 在歌曲中，切物象征用功读书，雕象牙意味着修身养性，打磨石头表明小心谨慎地工作，坚强果决是他的外貌描述。人们永远不会忘记这样一位具有高尚品德、崇高志向和端正行为的君子。

text.ori_cn: 君子贤其贤而亲其亲，小人乐其乐而利其利，?此以没世不忘也。
text.man_en: The emperors of ancient times valued virtuous gentlemen and were close to the gentlemen of his own clan. They shared their joys and profits with common people. This is why the posterity will remember them even though they have passed away.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The gentleman is virtuous and close to his relatives, and the villain is happy and profitable. This is not to be forgotten for all eternity.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A gentleman appreciates his virtuous people and loves his relatives, while a villain takes pleasure in them and benefits them. This is something that will never be forgotten until the end of the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A gentleman cherishes the virtuous and reveres his relatives; a petty person delights in his own pleasures and profits from his own gains. Therefore, they are remembered for generations.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 古代帝王重贤君子，亲近宗室君子。他们与平民百姓同甘共苦，利益共享。这也是他们虽已逝去，但后人仍会记得他们的原因。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 古之帝王重贤士，亲近本族君子。他们与普通百姓分享喜悦和利益。这就是为什么即使他们已经去世，后人也会记住他们。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 古代的帝王重视有德行的君子，并亲近自己家族的君子。他们与百姓共享欢乐和利益。这就是为什么他们虽已逝去，但后人仍然铭记他们的原因。

text.ori_cn: 为人君，止于仁；为人臣，止于敬；为人子，止于孝；为人父，止于慈；?与国人交，止于信。
text.man_en: As an emperor, a man should be benevolent. As a subordinate official, a man should pay respect to his superior. As a son, a man should be filial to his parents. As a father, a man should be kind to his children. A man should be credible and trustful in his contact with other people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: To be a ruler, stop at benevolence; to be a subject, stop at respect; to be a son, stop at filial piety; to be a father, stop at kindness;? To be a friend to the people of a nation, one must stop at faith.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To be a king, stop at benevolence; to be a minister, stop at respect; to be a son, stop at filial piety; to be a father, stop at kindness; to have friendship with the people of the country, stop at trust.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As a ruler, be benevolent; as a minister, be respectful; as a child, be filial; as a parent, be kind; and in interactions with fellow countrymen, be trustworthy.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 身为帝王，当仁不让。为臣者，当敬其上。为人子，当孝顺父母。为父者，当慈其子。人与人交往，要讲信用。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 作为一个皇帝，做人就应该仁慈。作为下级官员，应该尊重上级。作为一个儿子，应该孝顺父母。作为父亲，男人应该善待自己的孩子。一个人在与他人交往时应该是可信的、值得信赖的。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 作为皇帝，一个人应该仁慈。作为属下官员，一个人应该尊敬上级。作为儿子，一个人应该孝顺父母。作为父亲，一个人应该对孩子慈爱。在与他人接触中，一个人应该讲信用和可信。

text.ori_cn: §所谓修身在正其心者，身有所忿懥，则不得其正；有所恐惧，则不得其正；有所好乐，则不得其正；有所忧患，则不得其正。
text.man_en: “A man's selfcultivation depends on setting his heart right” in “Jing” means a man's heart cannot be set right if he resents, fears, or has favorites and worries.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The so-called cultivation of the body is in the correctness of the heart, the body has some anger, it is not correct; there is some fear, it is not correct; there is some pleasure, it is not correct; there is some worry, it is not correct.

text.ori_cn: 心不在焉，视而不见，听而不闻，食而不知其味。

Pi Yan.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: "一个人的家庭教育取决于他的自我修养 "是指一个人往往会偏爱他所爱的人，鄙视他所厌恶的人，尊重和敬畏他所敬畏的人，同情他所同情的人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: “家教在于修身”，就是偏爱所爱的人，轻视所厌恶的人，敬重敬畏的人，同情所怜悯的人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “齐家在修身”的意思是，一个人往往会偏爱他喜欢的人，轻视他讨厌的人，尊敬和畏惧那些让他敬畏的人，同情他可怜的人。

text.ori_cn: 故好而知其恶，恶而知其美者，天下鲜矣。
text.man_en: Now there are few who can discover the evils of the ones he likes and the good of the ones he detests.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, there are few people in the world who are good and know their evil, and those who are evil and know their beauty.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, there are only a few people in the world who know their evils when they are good, and know their beauty when they are evil.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, those who appreciate goodness but recognize its flaws, and those who dislike something but perceive its beauty, are rare in the world.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 现在，很少有人能发现他所喜欢的人的弊端和他所厌恶的人的优点。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 现在很少有人能发现他所喜欢的人的恶，他所厌恶的人的善了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 现在很少有人能发现自己喜欢的人有什么恶习，或者自己讨厌的人有什么优点。

text.ori_cn: 故谚有之曰：“人莫知其子之恶，莫知其苗之硕。”
text.man_en: As the saying has it: no one knows the evils of his son and no one is satisfied with his strong rice seedlings.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, there is a proverb that says, "No man knows the evil of his son, nor the fruitfulness of his seedling."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, there is a proverb that says: "No one knows the evil of his son, nor the strength of his seedling."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There is an old proverb that says: 'No one knows the faults of their own child, nor the growth of their own crops.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 俗话说：知子莫若父，知足莫若壮秧。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 俗话说：子之恶无人知，稻苗壮无人知。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 俗话说：没有人知道自己儿子的恶行，没有人对自己强壮的稻苗感到满意。

text.ori_cn: 此谓身不修，不可以齐其家。
text.man_en: This is why a man cannot educate his family if he had not cultivated himself well.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is to say that if the body is not cultivated, it cannot be aligned with the family.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that if you don't cultivate your body, you can't take care of your family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This means that without cultivating oneself, one cannot manage one's family properly.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是为什么一个人如果不好好修身养性，就无法教育好自己的家人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是为什么一个人如果没有好好修养自己，就无法教育他的家庭。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是为什么一个人如果没有很好地修养自己，就无法教育好他的家庭。

text.ori_cn: §所谓治国必先齐其家者，其家不可教,而能教人者无之。
text.man_en: “The ruling of a state depends on the education of a man's family” in “Jing” means it is impossible to educate others if a man can not educate his own family.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: As the saying goes, "To rule a country, one must first unify the family", the family is not teachable, and there is no one who can teach others.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that to govern a country, one must first put his family in order. His family cannot teach, but there is no one who can teach others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: As it is said, to govern a country, one must first bring order to one's own household; there is no one who can teach others without first being able to manage their own family.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "经》中 "治国以齐家 "的意思是，一个人如果不能教育好自己的家人，就不可能教育好别人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《经》“治国者乎其家”，是指一个人不能教育自己的家庭，就不可能教育别人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《经》中的“国治在家教”意味着如果一个人不能教育自己的家庭，就不可能教育别人。

text.ori_cn: 故君子不出家,而成教于国。
text.man_en: So, a gentleman can extend his education to the whole state without leaving his home.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, a gentleman does not leave his home, but becomes a teacher in his country.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a gentleman does not become a monk, but instead teaches in the country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a gentleman does not leave his home, but accomplishes his teachings within the nation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，一位绅士可以足不出户，将他的教育推广到全州。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，君子足不出户，就可以将自己的教育推广到全国。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，君子可以足不出户而通晓天下事。

text.ori_cn: 孝者，所以事君也；弟者，所以事长也；慈者，所以使众也。
text.man_en: If a son is filial to his parents, he will be loyal to his lord. If a man respects his elderly brother, he will respect his superiors. If he is kind to his children, he will take good care of his people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Filial piety is to serve the ruler; discipleship is to serve the elders; and charity is to make the people happy.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: To be filial is to serve the king; to be younger is to serve the emperor; to be kind is to serve others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Filial piety is the basis for serving one's ruler; fraternal duty is the basis for serving one's elders; kindness is the basis for leading the people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 子孝父母，则忠君。人敬其兄，则必敬其上。子慈，则民安。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 子孝父母，则忠于君。如果一个人尊重他的哥哥，他就会尊重他的上级。如果他善待他的孩子，他就会很好地照顾他的人民。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个儿子孝顺他的父母，他就会忠于他的君主。如果一个人尊敬他的哥哥，他就会尊重他的上级。如果他善待他的孩子，他就会善待他的人民。

text.ori_cn: 《康诰》曰：“如保赤子。”
text.man_en: “Kang Gao” said, “A lord should take care of his people as his children. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Letters Patent say, "As in the case of the preservation of the Red Son."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Kang Gao" says: "It is like protecting a pure child."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: 'The Announcement of Kang' states: 'Cherish it as if it were an infant.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "姜高 "说："君王应该像爱护自己的子女一样爱护自己的子民。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《康皋》曰：“君子当爱民如子。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 康高说：“君主要像照顾自己的孩子一样照顾百姓。”

text.ori_cn: 心诚求之，虽不中，不远矣。
text.man_en: If a man tries his best, he will not be far from being perfect.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If you are sincere in your search, you will not be far away, even if you don't win.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you sincerely seek it, even if you don't get it, it's not far away.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: With a sincere heart in seeking, even if the goal is not met, it will not be far off.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果一个人竭尽全力，他离完美就不远了。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 一个人如果尽力了，他离完美就不远了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个人尽了最大的努力，他就不会离完美太远。

text.ori_cn: 未有学养子而后嫁者也。
text.man_en: No woman would refrain from marrying because she does not know how to foster children.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: I have never learnt to raise a son and then marry him.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no one who has not learned how to raise a son and then marry.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There were no cases of women being educated before getting married.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 没有一个女人会因为不懂得如何养育孩子而不结婚。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 没有哪个女人会因为不知道如何养育孩子而不结婚。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 没有女人会因为自己不会抚养孩子而不结婚。

text.ori_cn: 一家仁，一国兴仁；一 家让，一国兴让；一人贪戾，一国作乱；其机如此。
text.man_en: If the lord practices benevolence in his own family, all people in his state will follow suit. If the lord is modest, the people in his state will be modest. If the lord is greedy and cruel, the people in his state will rebel against him. Motives determine consequences.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If a family is benevolent, a nation will be benevolent; if a family is lenient, a nation will be lenient; if a person is greedy and hostile, a nation will be in turmoil; and so it is.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a family is benevolent, a country will be benevolent; if a family makes concessions, a country will prosper; if one person is greedy and ruthless, a country will be in chaos; this is how it works.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a family practices benevolence, the whole nation becomes benevolent; when a family values courtesy, the whole nation becomes courteous. When a person is greedy and unrestrained, the whole nation falls into chaos; such is the mechanism.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果国君在自己的家庭中践行仁义，那么国中的所有人都会效仿。国君谦虚，国人也会谦虚。如果国君贪婪残暴，国人就会反抗他。动机决定后果。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果君主在自己的家庭中实行仁爱，那么他的国家的人民就会效仿。如果君主谦虚，那么他的国家的人民就会谦虚。如果君主贪婪残暴，他的国家的人民就会背叛他。动机决定后果。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果君主在自己的家族中施行仁政，国家的人民也会效仿。如果君主谦虚，国家的人民也会谦虚。如果君主贪婪残暴，国家的人民就会反叛他。动机决定后果。

text.ori_cn: 此谓一言偾事，一人定国。
text.man_en: So it is said one wrong word may spoil the whole thing and one right action will bring peace and stability to the state.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is said that a single word ruins a matter, but a single person defines a country.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that one word and one thing can determine the country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This so-called one word overturns affairs, one person stabilizes the nation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以说，一句错话可能会毁了整个事情，而一个正确的行动则会给国家带来和平与稳定。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以说，一言不慎，天下大事，一举一动，天下太平。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以说一句错误的话可能会坏事，而一个正确的行动将给国家带来和平与稳定。

text.ori_cn: 尧舜帅天下以仁，而民从之；桀纣帅天下以暴，而民从之。
text.man_en: Yao and Shun governed the world with benevolence and all the people practiced benevolence. Jie and Zhou governed the world with tyranny and all the people became cruel and fierce.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Yao and Shun marshalled the world with benevolence, and the people followed them; Jie and Zhou marshalled the world with violence, and the people followed them.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Yao and Shun commanded the world with benevolence, and the people followed it; Jie and Zhou commanded the world with violence, and the people followed it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Yao and Shun ruled the world with benevolence, and the people followed them; Jie and Zhou ruled the world with tyranny, and the people followed them.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 尧舜以仁治天下，百姓皆行仁义。桀、纣以暴虐治天下，天下人都变得残暴凶狠。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 尧舜以仁政天下，万民行仁。桀、纣统治天下，百姓变得残暴。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 尧舜以仁德治理天下，民众都践行仁德；桀纣以暴政治理天下，民众都变得残忍凶狠。

text.ori_cn: 其所令反其所好，而民不从。
text.man_en: People would not follow the lord's instruction to be benevolent if the lord himself is a tyrant.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: What he commands is contrary to what he wants, and the people do not obey.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What he ordered was contrary to what he wanted, but the people did not obey.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When those in authority go against their own preferences, the people will not follow.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果主公本身就是暴君，人们就不会听从主公的指示去行仁。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果君主本身是暴君，人们就不会听从君主的仁慈教导。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果领主自己是个暴君，人们就不会遵循他的仁慈教导。

text.ori_cn: 是故君子有诸已，而后求诸人；无诸已，而后非诸人。
text.man_en: So, a gentleman asks others to be kind if he himself is kind. A man can only criticize others if he himself makes no mistakes.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, a gentleman has to seek after others when he has already done so, and seeks after others when he has not already done so.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if a gentleman has his own self, he will seek help from others; if he has no self, he will seek help from others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, a noble person endeavors to possess virtues within himself before seeking them in others; and eliminates faults in himself before condemning them in others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以，君子要求别人仁慈，自己就应该仁慈。一个人只有自己不犯错误，才能批评别人。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，君子自己仁慈，别人也仁慈。一个人只有在自己没有犯错的情况下才能批评别人。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以，一个君子如果自己是善良的，那么他请求别人善良。如果一个人自己没有错误，那么他才能批评别人。

text.ori_cn: 所藏乎身不恕，而能喻诸人者，未之有也。
text.man_en: If he is not tolerant and just, he can not ask others to be tolerant and forgiving.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no one who hides his unforgiveness in his own body and is able to tell others about it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is no such thing as a person who cannot forgive what he has hidden in his body, but can describe it to others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There has never been anyone who could understand others but not tolerate what is within themselves.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果自己不宽容、不公正，就不能要求别人宽容、原谅自己。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果自己不宽容、不公正，就无法要求别人宽容、宽容。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果他不能宽容公正，他就不能要求别人宽容和原谅。

text.ori_cn: 故治国在齐其家。
text.man_en: So, he has to educate his family before he can rule a state.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, the rule of a country is to align its family.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, governing the country lies in Qi's family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, governing a country starts with managing one's own household.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，他必须先教育好家人，然后才能治理国家。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，他必须先教育他的家人，然后才能统治国家。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以，他必须先教导好家人，然后才能治理国家。

text.ori_cn: 《诗》云：“桃之夭夭，其叶蓁蓁。
text.man_en: The Book of Songs said, “The girl marries when peaches bloom luxuriously.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Poem reads: "The peach is young, its leaves are abundant.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Poetry" says: "When the peach is young, its leaves are pure.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Book of Songs says, 'The peach tree is young and flourishing, its leaves dense and luxuriant.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诗经》中说："桃之夭夭，灼灼其华。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《诗经》云：“桃花盛开，女子出嫁。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《诗经》说：“桃之夭夭，灼灼其华。之子于归，宜其室家。”

text.ori_cn: 之子于归，宜其家人。”
text.man_en: Their branches and leaves grow exuberantly and the whole family rejoices. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is appropriate for the son of a man to return to his family."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: When the son returns home, it will be a good time for his family. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The son, upon his return, would bring happiness to his family.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 它们的枝叶生长旺盛，全家人都很高兴。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 枝叶茂盛，全家欢乐。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 它们的枝叶茂盛，全家欢乐。

text.ori_cn: 宜其家人，而后可以教国人。
text.man_en: It is only when one's whole family is happy and pleased that he can educate the people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is appropriate for his family, and then he can teach his countrymen.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is suitable for his family, and then he can teach the people of the country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when one can make his family harmonious, can he teach the people of the nation.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有当一个人全家幸福快乐时，他才能教育人民。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有全家幸福、高兴，他才能教化人民。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只有当一个人的整个家庭都幸福和满意时，他才能教育人民。

text.ori_cn: 《诗》云：“宜兄宜弟。”
text.man_en: The Book of Songs said, “Both elder and younger brothers are happy. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Psalmist said, "It is appropriate for a brother to be a brother."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Poetry" says: "Brothers are better than brothers."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Book of Songs says: 'Be a good brother to your siblings.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诗经》中说："长幼同乐。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《诗经》曰：“兄弟皆乐。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《诗经》曰：“兄弟怡怡。”

text.ori_cn: 宜兄宜弟，而后可以教国人。
text.man_en: It is only when both the elder and younger brothers are happy that they can educate the people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is appropriate for a brother to be a brother, and then he can teach his countrymen.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: They are like brothers and brothers, and then they can teach the people of the country.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only when one can treat both elder and younger brothers properly, can he then teach the people of the nation.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有兄弟都高兴，才能教化百姓。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只有当兄弟俩都感到高兴时，他们才能教育人民。

text.ori_cn: 《诗》云：“其仪不忒，正是四国。”
text.man_en: The Book of Songs said, “A man's appearance should be solemn and serious. He should set an example to others. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The Poem reads, "Its ceremonies are not the same as those of the four kingdoms."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Poetry" says: "Its appearance is not too special, it is the Four Kingdoms."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Book of Songs says: 'Their conduct is unimpeachable, and they set an example for the four quarters.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诗经》说："人的外表应该庄重严肃。他应该为他人树立榜样。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《诗经》曰：“男子之相，当庄重。他应该为其他人树立榜样。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《诗经》曰：“一言之美，取其衣冠，中正导人。”

text.ori_cn: 其为父子兄弟足法，而后民法之也。
text.man_en: It is only when either the father, the son, or the brother behaves like the model that the people will follow their examples.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is the law of the feet of fathers and sons and brothers, and then the law of the people.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is the foot law of father, son and brother, and then the civil law.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: It serves as a guide for fathers, sons, and brothers, and only then does it become a law for the people.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有当父亲、儿子或兄弟的行为像榜样一样时，人们才会以他们为榜样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有当父亲、儿子、兄弟中的任何一个表现得像模范时，人们才会效仿他们的榜样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 只有当父亲、儿子或兄弟中的一位行为像榜样时，人们才会跟随他们的例子.

text.ori_cn: 此谓治国在齐其家。
text.man_en: This is what the ruling of a state lies in the education of a family means.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is to say that the rule of a country is in the unification of its family.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that governing the country depends on the family.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This means that governing the nation lies in managing one's household.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这就是 "治国在于齐家 "的含义。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是国家的治理在于家庭的教育。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这就是国家治理依赖于家庭教育的含义。

text.ori_cn: §所谓平天下在治其国者，上老老，而民兴孝；上长长，而民兴弟；上恤孤，而民不倍。
text.man_en: “The governance of the world depends on the ruling of the state” in “Jing” means if the lord honors the aged in his state, his people will be filial to their parents; if the lord respects his elders, his people will respect their elder brothers; if the lord sympathizes with the helpless, his people will disobey him.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The so-called flat world in the rule of his country, on the old old, and the people Xing filial piety; on the long long, and the people Xing brother; on the compassionate orphan, and the people do not double.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is said that those who govern their country in a peaceful world should care for the old and the people, but the people will be filial.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Governing a nation well leads to peace in the world: when those in power respect the elderly, the people will naturally become filial; when those in power honor the virtuous, the people will naturally show loyalty; when those in power care for the orphaned, the people will not abandon their responsibilities.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: "经 "中的 "天下之治，在国之治"，是说国君孝敬老人，百姓就会孝敬父母；国君尊敬长辈，百姓就会尊敬兄长；国君同情无助的人，百姓就会不服从他。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《经》中的“治天下，以治国”，是说君主在国家孝敬老人，那么人民就会孝顺父母；如果国家孝敬老人，那么人民就会孝顺父母。君主尊敬长辈，人民就会尊敬兄弟；君主尊敬长辈，人民就会尊敬兄弟。如果君主同情弱者，他的人民就会违背他。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: “经”中的“天下之治在乎国”的意思是，如果君主在国中尊敬长者，人民就会孝顺父母；如果君主尊重他的长辈，人民就会尊敬他们的兄长；如果君主同情无助者，人民就会违背他。

text.ori_cn: 是以君子有絜矩之道也。
text.man_en: So, a gentleman holds the principle of putting himself in the place of others.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is because a gentleman has the way of rectitude.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a gentleman has the right and correct way.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a gentleman possesses the way of self-discipline and propriety.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，君子秉持设身处地为他人着想的原则。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以，君子秉持着设身处地为他人着想的原则。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以，君子以己度人。

text.ori_cn: 所恶于上，毋以使下；所恶于下，毋以事上；所恶于前，毋以先后；所恶于后，毋以从前；所恶于右，毋以交于左；所恶于左，毋以交于右。
text.man_en: I will not treat my subordinates with the attitude that I would hate for my superiors to treat me. I will not serve my superior with the attitude with which I would hate my subordinates to serve me. I will not deal with the one behind me with the attitude which I hate the one in front to deal with me, nor will I deal with the one in front of me with the attitude with which I hate the one behind to deal with me. I will not force the one on my left to accept what I would hate the one on my right to force me to accept, nor will I force the on my right to accept what I would hate the one on my left to force me to accept.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: What is evil to the upper, do not make the lower; what is evil to the lower, do not serve the upper; what is evil to the former, do not precede; what is evil to the latter, do not precede; what is evil to the right, do not cross over to the left; what is evil to the left, do not cross over to the right.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you hate those above, don't do it to those below; if you hate those below, don't do it to those above; if you hate the front, don't do it in order; if you hate the back, don't do it to the past; if you hate the right, don't do it to the left. Those who hate the left should not be handed over to the right.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What one dislikes being done unto oneself by those above, do not make those below do; what one dislikes being done unto oneself by those below, do not do unto those above; what one dislikes in what is ahead, do not impose as precedence; what one dislikes from what is behind, do not follow as precedent; what one dislikes on the right, do not impose on the left; what one dislikes on the left, do not impose on the right.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 我不会以我讨厌上级对待我的态度来对待下级。我不会以我讨厌我的下属为我服务的态度为我的上司服务。我不会用我讨厌前面的人对待我的态度来对待后面的人，也不会用我讨厌后面的人对待我的态度来对待前面的人。我不会强迫我左边的人接受我讨厌我右边的人强迫我接受的东西，我也不会强迫我右边的人接受我讨厌我左边的人强迫我接受的东西。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 我不会以我不喜欢上级对待我的态度来对待我的下属。我不会以我讨厌下属为我服务的态度来服务我的上级。我不会用我讨厌前面的人来对待我的态度来对待我后面的人，也不会用我讨厌后面的人来对待我的态度来对待我前面的人。我不会强迫我左边的人接受我讨厌我右边的人强迫我接受的东西，我也不会强迫我右边的人接受我讨厌我左边的人强迫我接受的东西。

text.ori_cn: 此之谓絜矩之道。

text.ori_cn: 有国者不可以不慎，辟则为天下僇矣。
text.man_en: The ruler of a state has to be cautious, for with the slightest deviations from the right way, he will be deposed.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who have a country cannot be imprudent, and if they are not, the world will be killed.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who have a country must not be careless, otherwise they will be slaughtered by the world.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A nation cannot afford to be careless, for if so, it will become a laughingstock to the world.

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 国君必须慎重，稍有不正之道，就会被废黜。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一国之君必须谨慎，因为稍有偏离正道，他将被废黜。

text.man_en: The Book of Songs said, “When the Yin Dynasty still had the confidence of the people, its virtues accorded with the demands of Heaven.

text.man_en2dpl_cn: 诗经》说："殷朝尚有民信，其德合于天命。

text.ori_cn: 仪监于殷，峻命不易。”
text.man_en: The Yin Dynasty serves as an example that it is not easy to maintain the mandate of Heaven. ”

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The instrument is in charge of the Yin Dynasty, and the order is not easy. "

text.man_en2ggl_cn: 殷朝就是一个例子，要维持天命并不容易。 ”

text.ori_cn: 道得众则得国，失众则失国。
text.man_en: This means anyone who has the support of people can keep the state, and anyone who loses the support of people will lose the state.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: When the Tao gains the multitude, it gains the kingdom; when it loses the multitude, it loses the kingdom.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If Tao wins people, the country will be gained; if it loses people, the country will be lost.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Gaining the people means gaining the country, losing the people means losing the country.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 这意味着，谁得到人民的支持，谁就能保住国家，谁失去人民的支持，谁就会失去国家。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 这就是说，谁得到人民的支持，谁就能保住国家；谁失去人民的支持，谁就会失去国家。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 这意味着任何得到人民支持的人都可以保住国家，而任何失去人民支持的人将失去国家。

text.ori_cn: 是故君子先慎乎德。
text.man_en: As a lord, the priority is to cultivate virtues.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, a gentleman is first prudent in virtue.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, a gentleman should first be cautious about virtue.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, a gentleman first carefully considers virtue.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 作为领主，首要任务是培养美德。

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 作为一位领主，首要任务是培养美德。

text.ori_cn: 有德此有人，有人此有土，有土此有财，有财此有用。
text.man_en: With virtues, he can have the support of the people. With the support of the people, he can keep the land. With the land, he can produce wealth and with wealth, he can balance the treasury.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is virtue and this is man, and there is man and this is earth, and there is earth and this is wealth, and there is wealth and this is useful.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a person with virtue, there is earth for a person, there is wealth for someone with earth, and there is use for wealth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Where there is virtue, there are people; where there are people, there is land; where there is land, there is wealth; where there is wealth, there is utility.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 有了美德，就能得到人民的支持。有了民心，就能保住土地。有了土地，他就能创造财富，有了财富，他就能平衡国库。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 有了德行，就能得到人民的拥护。有了人民的支持，他就能保住土地。有了土地，就可以产生财富；有了财富，就可以平衡国库。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 有德行，他能得到人民的支持。有了人民的支持，他能保住土地。有了土地，他能生产财富。有了财富，他能平衡国库。

text.ori_cn: 德者，本也；财者，末也。
text.man_en: So virtues are the root of a state and wealth is only a branch.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Virtue is the essence; wealth is the end.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Virtue is the foundation; wealth is the end.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Virtue is the foundation; wealth is the branch.

text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以，德行是国家的根本，而财富只是枝叶。

text.ori_cn: 外本内末，争民施夺。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The outside world is the centre and the inside world is the end, and the people are fighting for the people and taking them away.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The external foundation is the internal end, fighting for the people and giving away things.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Externally, they prioritize material gain; internally, they compete for people's support and impose measures of control.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果领主把树根看得不重要，而把树枝看得很重要，他就是在鼓励从人民身上榨取财富。

text.ori_cn: 是故财聚则民散，财散则民聚。
text.man_en: If a lord accumulates wealth by unscrupulous means and causes the people to suffer, the people will wander about like refugees.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, when wealth is gathered, the people are dispersed, and when wealth is dispersed, the people are gathered.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, when wealth gathers, the people disperse, and when wealth disperses, the people gather.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, when wealth is concentrated, the people are dispersed; when wealth is distributed, the people are united.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果领主不择手段地积累财富，使人民遭受苦难，人民就会像难民一样四处流浪。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果君主不择手段地积累财富，使人民受苦，人民就会像难民一样流浪。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果君主通过不正当手段积累财富，导致人民受苦，人民就会像难民一样流离失所。

text.ori_cn: 是故言悖逆而出者，亦悖而入；货悖而入者，亦悖而出。
text.man_en: But if he distributes his wealth to the people and the people lead prosperous and happy lives, the people will pay allegiance to him. Wealth gained unfairly would be lost unfairly just as a man's words will not be followed if these words are uttered without reason.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, those who say that they are rebellious and go out are also rebellious and go in; those who say that goods are rebellious and go in are also rebellious and go out.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This is why it is said that what goes out against the grain also goes in against the grain; what goes in against the grain also goes out against the grain.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Therefore, those who speak rebellious words will receive rebellion; those who gain wealth through rebellion will lose it through rebellion.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 但如果他把财富分配给人民，人民过上富裕幸福的生活，人民就会效忠于他。不公平地获得的财富会不公平地失去，就像一个人说的话，如果毫无道理，就不会得到遵守一样。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 但如果他把财富分配给人民，人民过上富裕幸福的生活，人民就会效忠他。不公平地获得的财富也会不公平地失去，就像一个人的言论如果没有理由的话就不会被遵守一样。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 但如果他将财富分配给人民，人民过上繁荣幸福的生活，人民就会效忠于他。不公平得来的财富也会不公平地失去，就像无理的话语不会被追随一样。

text.ori_cn: 《康诰》曰：“惟命不于常。”

text.ori_cn: 《楚书》曰：“楚国无以为宝，惟善以为宝。”

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The uncle's prisoner said, "The dead man is not thought to be a treasure, but the benevolent relatives are thought to be a treasure."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: The uncle said: "The dead are not treasured, but benevolence and relatives are."
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The bandit chief said, 'The deceased had no treasures to leave behind, for he regarded benevolence towards his parents as his greatest treasure.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 晋文公的叔父谷子范对秦国使者说："我们难民没有什么可珍惜的，只有仁慈。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 晋文公的叔父谷子范对秦使者说：“我们流民除了仁义之外，没有什么可珍惜的。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 晋文公的叔父谷子范对秦国的使者说：“我们这些流亡之人没有什么可以珍惜的，只有恩情。”

text.ori_cn: 《秦誓》曰：“若有一个臣，断断兮，无他技，其心休休焉，其如有容焉。
text.man_en: The Book of History said, “If a high official is no more than loyal and tolerant,

text.ori_cn2ggl_en: "Qin Oath" says: "If there is a minister who is Duan Duanxi and has no other skills, his heart will be restless and he will have a face.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: The Qin Oath states: 'If there be one minister, earnest and without other skills, whose heart is calm and serene, it is as if he possesses tolerance.'
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 史记》中说："若高官者，不过忠忍而已、
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 《尚书》云：“大夫不过忠忍，
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 《尚书》说：“如果一位高官不过是忠诚和宽容，

text.ori_cn: 人之有技，若已有之；人之彦圣，其心好之，不啻若自其口出，?实能容之。
text.man_en: if he appreciates other's talents as his own, if he is glad to see that others are virtuous and talented, if he not only expresses his appreciation in words but is really tolerant in his heart,
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: People have skills, if they already have; people's Yan Sheng, his heart is good, no less than if it comes out of his mouth,? The truth is that they can tolerate it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If a person has skills, he already has them; if a person is a sage, if his heart is fond of it, it is as if it comes from his mouth, and he can really tolerate it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When others possess a skill, one should regard it as if it were one's own; when others demonstrate wisdom and virtuousness, one should appreciate it as if it were spoken from one's own mouth. Truly, one should be able to embrace it wholeheartedly.

text.ori_cn: 唯仁人放流之，迸诸四夷，不与同中国。
text.man_en: Benevolent people will banish such persons to barbarious areas, prohibiting them to live among benevolent people in China.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Only the benevolent people let flow, burst all the four barbarians, not with the same China.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Only benevolent people will exile them and spread them among the barbarians, and they will not be the same as China.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Only the benevolent would exile them, banish them to the barbarians, and not allow them to remain in China.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 仁者会将这些人驱逐到蛮荒之地，禁止他们在中国与仁者共处。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 仁慈的人会将这样的人驱逐到野蛮地区，禁止他们与中国的仁慈的人生活在一起。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 仁慈的人会将这些人放逐到荒蛮地区，禁止他们与中国的仁慈民众同住。

text.ori_cn: 此谓唯仁人为能爱人，能恶人。
text.man_en: Only benevolent people know what to love and what to detest.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is said to be the only benevolent person who is capable of loving people and being evil.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that only benevolent people can love others and hate others.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This means that only a benevolent person can both love and despise others.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 只有仁者才知道什么该爱，什么该憎。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 只有仁慈的人才知道什么是喜爱什么是厌恶什么。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 唯有仁者才知道该爱什么和该憎恨什么。

text.ori_cn: 见贤而不能举，举而不能先，命也。
text.man_en: If a lord cannot appoint man of virtues to high position or will not appoint him to high position first, he is guilty of negligence.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Seeing the wise but not being able to lift, lifting but not being able to be first, the destiny is also.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Seeing a virtuous person but not being able to lift them up, being unable to be the first to lift them up is fate.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: To recognize virtue but not promote it, to promote it but not give it priority, that is fate.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果领主不能任命有德行的人担任要职，或者不首先任命他担任要职，那么他就犯了玩忽职守罪。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果君主不能任命有德的人为高位，或者不先任命他为高位，那就是过失了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一个君主不能将有德之人任命到高位，或者不愿先将他任命到高位，那么他就是失职。

text.ori_cn: 见不善而不能退，退而不能远，过也。
text.man_en: If a lord cannot dismiss a wicked official or would not exile him to wilderness after dismissal, he is guilty of making a grave mistake.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: It is also too much to see badness and not be able to retreat from it, and to retreat from it and not be able to go far away from it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If you see something bad and cannot retreat, if you retreat but cannot go far, that is too much.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Seeing wrongdoing and being unable to withdraw, or withdrawing but not going far, is still a fault.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果诸侯不能罢免奸臣，或罢免后不将其流放荒野，那就是犯了大错。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果一个君主不能罢免恶臣，或者罢免后又不将他流放到荒野，那么他就犯了严重的错误。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果一位君主不能罢免邪恶的官员，或者罢免后不将其流放到荒野，他就犯了一个重大的错误。

text.ori_cn: 好人之所恶，恶人之所好，是谓拂人之性，菑必逮夫身。
text.man_en: Disaster will befall on the lord whose likes and dislikes are just the opposite of the masses.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: A good man's evil and an evil man's good are the same as the nature of a man.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: What good people hate, evil people like, this means that if you mess with people's nature, you will catch your husband's body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: What good people detest, bad people like. This goes against human nature, and disaster will surely follow.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 喜恶与大众相反的领主将遭受灾难。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 与大众的好恶相反的君主，将会遭受灾难。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 那些喜好与大众完全相反的君主，将遭遇灾难。

text.ori_cn: 是故君子有大道，必忠信以得之，骄泰以失之。
text.man_en: So the only way to rule a state is to be honest and sincere. Pride and luxury will lead him to depart from the right way.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Therefore, when a gentleman has a great way, he must be loyal and faithful in order to gain it, and proud of Thailand in order to lose it.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Therefore, if a gentleman has a great road, he must be loyal and trustworthy in order to gain it, and he must be arrogant and arrogant in order to lose it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Thus, a noble person possesses the great Way: loyalty and trust enable them to obtain it, while arrogance and complacency lead them to lose it.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 所以，治国的唯一途径就是廉洁和真诚。傲慢和奢华会让他背离正道。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以治理国家的唯一方法就是诚实和真诚。骄傲和奢侈会使他偏离正道。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 所以，治理国家的唯一方法就是诚实和真诚。骄傲和奢侈会使他偏离正道。

text.ori_cn: 生财有大道:生之者众，食之者寡；为之者疾，用之者舒，则财恒足矣。
text.man_en: The important principle of accumulating wealth is to have more people engaged in spending, to accumulate assiduously and spend frugally. In this way, wealth will be more than enough.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is an avenue for generating wealth: those who are born are many, those who eat are few; those who are sick, those who use are comfortable, then the wealth is always enough.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: There is a great way to generate wealth: many are born, few are fed; those who do it are sick, and those who use it are comfortable, then the wealth will be constant and sufficient.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There are great principles to prosper: When there are many who produce and fewer who consume; those who work speedily and those who use leisurely, then wealth will always be sufficient.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 积累财富的重要原则是让更多的人参与消费，勤于积累，节俭消费。这样，财富就会绰绰有余。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 积累财富的重要原则是让更多的人去消费，勤俭积累，节约消费。这样，财富就绰绰有余了。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 积累财富的重要原则是让更多的人参与消费，勤奋积累，节俭花费。这样，财富就会绰绰有余。

text.ori_cn: 仁者以财发身，不仁者以身发财。
text.man_en: A kind and benevolent lord distributes his wealth to his people to make the most of his virtues, and the heartless lord casts away his virtue to extort wealth from his people.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Those who are benevolent get rich with their wealth, and those who are not benevolent get rich with their body.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: A benevolent person uses wealth to make a fortune, and an unkind person makes a fortune with his or her body.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: A benevolent person uses wealth to improve oneself, while an unbenevolent person uses oneself to gain wealth.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 仁慈的君主将财富分配给他的子民，以充分发挥他的美德；无情的君主则丢弃美德，向他的子民勒索财富。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 仁慈的君主将自己的财富分配给人民，以发挥他的德行；无情的君主则抛弃自己的德行，以勒索人民的财富。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一位仁慈和善良的君主将财富分给他的人民以充分体现他的美德，而无情的君主抛弃他的美德以从人民那里榨取财富。

text.ori_cn: 未有上好仁,而下不好义者也；未有好义,其事不终者也；未有府库财,非其财者也。
text.man_en: It never happens that superiors are kind and benevolent but the subordinates are unjust. Neither will it happen that a just subordinate starts doing something but does not carry it through. Nor does it happen that wealth stored in state repository does not belong to the lord.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: There is no one who is good at benevolence, but not good at righteousness; there is no one who is good at righteousness, but not at the end of his business; there is no one whose wealth is not his wealth.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: If there is no good benevolence at the top, but bad justice at the bottom; if there is no good righteousness, the work will not end; if there is no treasury and wealth, it is not his wealth.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: There has never been one who esteemed benevolence and did not also value righteousness; there has never been one who valued righteousness and did not see their duties through to the end; there has never been one whose treasury was filled with wealth that was not rightfully theirs.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 上级仁慈而下级不公的情况绝不会发生。也不会出现公正的下级开始做事却不去做的情况。也不会出现国家仓库里的财富不属于主人的情况。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 从来不会出现上级仁慈而下级不公正的情况。也不会出现正义下属开始做某事却没有贯彻到底的情况。国库中储存的财富也并非不属于领主。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 上级仁爱，下属却不公，是绝不会发生的。正义的下属不会半途而废。国家库存中的财富不属于君主，也是不会发生的。

text.ori_cn: §孟献子曰：“畜马乘，不察于鸡豚；伐冰之家，不畜牛羊；百乘之家，不畜聚敛之臣。
text.man_en: Meng Xian Zi, a virtuous official of Lu said, “Officials should not feed chickens and dogs; high officials should not raise cows and sheep; and lords and dukes should appoint subordinates to a high position who extort wealth from the people.

text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Meng Xianzi said, 'A household with horses does not scrutinize their chickens and pigs; a household that cuts ice does not raise cattle and sheep; a household with a hundred chariots does not employ ministers who gather wealth.'

text.ori_cn: 与其有聚敛之臣，宁有盗臣。”
text.man_en: Lords and dukes had better appoint subordinates who steal their own property than those who extort wealth from the people. ”
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: Instead of having ministers of amassing, it is better to have ministers of theft."
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: It is better to have rogue ministers than to have ministers who gather together. "
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Rather than having an official who amasses wealth, it is better to have a corrupt official.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 领主和公爵最好任命那些偷窃自己财产的下属，而不是那些勒索人民财富的下属。"
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 诸侯诸侯，宁可任命偷窃自己财产的臣子，也不要任命那些勒索百姓财富的臣子。 ”
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 诸侯和公爵最好任命那些偷取自己财产的部下，而不是那些敲诈人民财富的人。

text.ori_cn: 此谓国不以利为利，以义为利也。
text.man_en: A state should take morality and justice but not profit as wealth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is to say that the state does not take profit for profit, but righteousness for profit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that the country does not regard profit as profit, but righteousness as profit.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This means that a nation does not consider profit as profit, but takes righteousness as profit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 国家应以道义为重，而不应以利益为财。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 国家应当以道义为重，而不以利为财。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 一个国家应该以道德和正义为财富，而不是以利益为财富。

text.ori_cn: 长国家而务财用者，必自小人矣。
text.man_en: A ruler must not be instigated by petty person to extort wealth.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: The person who grows the country and is in the business of wealth and use, will be from the small man.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: Those who want to grow a country and take care of finances must become a small person.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: Those who govern a nation but prioritize financial gain must surely be petty individuals.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 统治者决不能受小人唆使而勒索钱财。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 君主不可以受小人的怂恿而去谋取财富。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 君主不可被小人煽动而敛财。

text.ori_cn: 彼为善之，小人之使为国家，菑害并至，虽有善者，亦无如之何矣。
text.man_en: Disaster will strike if petty persons are asked to help rule the state. Under such circumstances, no gentleman could save the state.
text.ori_cn2dpl_en: If he is a good man, but the villain's make for the country, and the field recently opened to him, even though there is a good man, there is nothing more to be done.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: He is a good person, and the villain is responsible for the country, and he will do harm to the country. Although there are good people, they are nothing like it.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: When a good person administers a task, petty people cause harm to the state. When disaster strikes, even if there are good individuals, there is nothing that can be done.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 如果要求小人物帮助治理国家，灾难就会降临。在这种情况下，任何君子都无法拯救国家。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 如果让小人来治理国家，就会有灾难。在这种情况下，任何君子都救不了国家。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 如果让小人协助治理国家，灾难就会降临。在这种情况下，君子也无法挽救国家。

text.ori_cn: 此谓国不以利为利，以义为利也。

text.ori_cn2dpl_en: This is to say that the state does not take profit for profit, but righteousness for profit.
text.ori_cn2ggl_en: This means that the country does not regard profit as profit, but righteousness as profit.
text.ori_cn2gpt_en: This means that a nation does not consider profit as profit, but regards righteousness as profit.
text.man_en2dpl_cn: 因此，国家不应以利益为财富，而应以道德和正义为财富。
text.man_en2ggl_cn: 所以国家不应该以利益为财富，而应该以道义为财富。
text.man_en2gpt_cn: 因此，一个国家不应以利益为财富，而应以道德和正义为财富。
